text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with grilled prosciutto wrapped
peaches with burrata and basil that's
right please don't let that long name
fool you
the ingredient list is short and the
results were stunning and by the way I
think I'm going to do a new thing or
when I come back from vacation the first
video I post is going to be of the most
delicious thing I had during the break
and this was that which really is saying
something since about 95% of my
vacations are spent eating delicious
things so with that in mind let's go
ahead and get started with the teaches
of peaches and in today's lesson we're
going to focus on how to remove the
stone and cut these up so what we want
to do is take a sharp knife and
carefully cut straight in until we feel
that blade hit the stone and once that
happens we'll just slice it all the way
around like this and then if we give
those two halves a twist they should
separate easily and then once that's
been accomplished we'll just pull out
that stone and that's all there is to it
and by the way there's no need to peel
these just leave the peel on they're
going to look better they're going to
taste better plus the extra nutrients in
that skin are going to cancel out the
negative effects from the pork fat oh
yeah it's the perfect system but anyway
we're going to cut those in half and
remove the stone at which point we can
cut these into any size we want so I'm
gonna go ahead and cut these halves in
half so I'm gonna get four pieces per
peach which is going to give me a size I
think works best on the grill but if you
happen to be using giant peaches
possibly from your friend James then
maybe you cut each half and thirds to
get six per peach that kind of thing is
going to be up to you but ultimately you
do want to end up with something about
this size then once our peach pieces
have been prepped they're ready to wrap
up prosciutto and poke so before we
start we're going to want to soak some
bamboo skewers or toothpicks in some
water so those don't catch on fire on
the grill and then all we're going to do
is wrap each piece with a stripper
prosciutto and we'll wrap that around a
few times and secure it with our skewer
so very simple operation and of course
you can put on as much prosciutto as you
want I have done these before where I've
wrapped them completely in the ham and
they are delicious but I do prefer if
some of the peach is poking out both
ends and yes if you want you can put on
more than one per skewer but I thought I
would have a little more control doing
them individually but it also turned out
to be kind of a pain as you'll see
nothing major although next time I'll
probably just use smaller toothpicks but
anyway we are going to wrap and
those peaches as we see fit at which
point we will transfer those onto a
plate and head out to the grill and
ideally you're going to char grill these
so you get that little bit of smokiness
and yes of course you can use a gas
grill
they just won't taste quite as good but
anyway we're going to place those down
and simply grill them for a few minutes
per side until our prosciutto kind of
crisp up a little bit and our peach
warms through and those edges get a
little bit caramelized and as I
mentioned earlier I probably would just
use regular toothpicks next time is
these longer bamboo skewers were a
little awkward to use on the grill but
you know what I really do hate to
complain about something that wasn't
really a problem so somehow someway I
was able to flip those around until like
I said that prosciutto got a little bit
crispy around the edges and that
gorgeous juicy fruit started to heat
through and by the way please note when
you're wrapping these don't worry about
being perfect as you may be able to see
any of those little torn scraggly pieces
of prosciutto those are the bits that
are going to get extra caramelized and
make this look and taste even better so
if you do see a little piece of ham here
they're getting a little dark a little
golden black don't worry everything's
going to be fine
just stay calm and Grill on and of
course I'm going to finish before others
so when you think they're good pull them
off and once all our prosciutto wrapped
peaches have been successfully grilled
we will head back inside for final
assembly
now before we plate up I should mention
you could totally serve it just like
this those would make a very handsome
appetizer maybe drizzle with a little
bit of olive oil so if you are lactose
intolerant or just lactose indifferent
that is an option but not for me I'm
going to go ahead and pull out these
skewers so we can plate this up as
follows we are going to take a nice big
scoop of burrata cheese and if you
haven't had the pleasure burrata is an
extra creamy extra rich form of
mozzarella I know it almost looks more
like ricotta but it's not and we will
talk a little bit about burrata I'm a
blog post since it really is something
you want to introduce into your life and
then once our cheese is down we will
surround that with our still warm
absolutely gorgeous looking grilled
prosciutto wrapped peaches and then
we'll finish off with a nice drizzle of
extra virgin olive oil not too much but
a little sprinkling will help tie all
this together and then I'm going to give
this a nice sprinkling of sea salt and
as you'll notice I'm using something it
has nice large flakes so we can see it
and feel it
and I will also do a little touch of
freshly ground black pepper just a
couple grinds and then last but not
least a little chiffonade of fresh basil
and for whatever reason if you're not
into basil some fresh thyme in
particular some lemon thyme would be
very nice with this but that's up to you
you are the peaches and herb of your
peaches and herb and as good as this
looks and you got a minute looks pretty
good
the combination of tastes and textures
here is just off the charts I mean we
have that salty ham wrapping that sweet
juicy fruit both of which have been
kissed by that smoky grill and when you
pair that with that extra creamy extra
rich extra decadent mozzarella you have
something that's beyond fantastic and by
the way just in case you're wondering
this is technically an appetizer if I
had a pick a category but this would
make an incredibly interesting a savory
style dessert Oh Fitz summer and peaches
a ripe I would take this over a slice of
pie any day but anyway that's it
prosciutto wrap grilled peaches with
burrata like I said it was just off for
a week and had countless things that
were incredibly delicious but none more
so than this so I really do hope you
give this a try head over to food wishes
comm for all the ingredient amounts and
more info as usual and as always enjoy
[Music]
